body_html:
Sure, for Android, make sure your bazel Android environment is configured properly (see this guide). You can build the C library with:

bazel build -c opt --cxxopt=--std=c++11 \
  --config=android_arm \
  //tensorflow/lite/experimental/c:libtensorflowlite_c.so

If you want to use the C++ API you'll need to tweak the linker script to avoid stripping the C++ symbols.
body_text:
Sure, for Android, make sure your bazel Android environment is configured properly (see this guide). You can build the C library with:
bazel build -c opt --cxxopt=--std=c++11 \
  --config=android_arm \
  //tensorflow/lite/experimental/c:libtensorflowlite_c.so

If you want to use the C++ API you'll need to tweak the linker script to avoid stripping the C++ symbols.
body:
Sure, for Android, make sure your bazel Android environment is configured properly (see [this guide](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/lite/java/demo)). You can build the C library with:

```
bazel build -c opt --cxxopt=--std=c++11 \
  --config=android_arm \
  //tensorflow/lite/experimental/c:libtensorflowlite_c.so
```

If you want to use the C++ API you'll need to tweak the [linker script](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/lite/experimental/c/BUILD#L20) to avoid stripping the C++ symbols.
